data.title: Tweaked GWT reflection
data.body:
- Added CachedTypeLookup for Class-fields which were often looked up using ReflectionCache.getType
- the get-Method/-Field methods of Type now cache the list of methods/fields so the class hierarchy traversal is only necessary once
- Parameter objects for methods and constructors are now reused in IReflectionCacheGenerated by assigning each unique parameter to a variable which can be used multiple times.
- newArrayC in IReflectionCacheGenerated used another logic for calculating the class name for the lookup.
- the assignable-Set of Type always contained Object.class and the current type's class. This is redundant as this can be checked by comparing the class types. This way for a lot of Types the assignables-Set can be empty.
- Removed an unused Test class

data.title: Added gradle support for running texturePacker at build time.
data.body:
Make sure the proper ext.texturePacker parameter is set in the toplevel
gradle.build file and have TexturePacker run with those whenever the
"texturePacker" task gets invoked, e.g. "./gradlew texturePacker
desktop:run".

data.title: GWT Reflection: simplified generated code
data.body: The Reflection Cache uses now integer ids instead of strings for type/method/constructor lookups. This greatly simplifies the generated code.

data.title: TextField setMaxLength()
data.body:
There is a bug in TextField when max length is set. If I click on TF then it's content is selected and if I type something it gets cleaned and my new content appears. But if I set max length to 10 for example and fill it with 10 letters then when I click on TF, content gets selected but it does not clear when I type something. I have to press backspace or delete and then start typing.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. setMaxLength on TF.
2. write max length text in it.
3. click on this tf to get it's content selected.
4. try to type new content - it's not getting cleared.

I'm using libgdx nightly version from 6th November.

data.title: Upgrade to the 0.0.3 version of the RoboVM Gradle plugin
LiveWallpapers with non-continuous rendering are missing some offsetsChanged notifications
data.body:
If an application is used as a LiveWallpaper and set to non-continuous rendering, _offsetsChanged_ notifications are not dispatched to the render thread in the following situations:
1. **The user presses the _home_ button to go to the central screen:** since the _home_ button is not part of the live wallpaper, no input event is processed by libgdx and no render is performed. 
2. **The user swipes to go to a sibling screen:** here, input events are generated while the user keeps his/her finger on the screen, producing normal rendering. However, if the user stops touching the screen in the middle of a screen transition, the screen is automatically advanced to the next one or automatically returned to the original one. In both cases, _offsetsChanged_ events are generated, but since there is no input event, there is also no rendering.

This patch solves the problem by ensuring the _Gdx.graphics.requestRendering()_ is called right after every call to _notifyOffsetsChanged()_ in the AndroidLiveWallpaperService.

data.title: MathUtils.randomItem(array) for random item from array
data.body: I use (gdx utils) Array.random() a lot, it's quite handy.  I often miss it when working with arrays, so I added this.

data.title: headless mock docs, delete my random trash
Additional radian based methods
data.body:
Added radian based mothods with Rad suffix.

I additionally created new radian/degree conversion values in MathUtils that match Java naming convention. (ALL_CAPS)

I given them short names like RADIANS and DEGREES instead of something like RAD_TO_DEG. Hopefully this isn't confusing. Anyway javadoc comment is added to clear this up.

If those are fine, the old camelCase ones perhaps should be removed?

data.title: better error handling of null style argument for TextButton
data.body:
before this the error message on passing a null argument doesn't make it completely obvious what the problem is:

```
// pass null as style
Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: style must be a TextButtonStyle.
```

data.title: Updated GWT/HTML5 Backend to 2.6.0
data.body:
- Java 7 Support (yay!)
- Jars pulled from maven central ( http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Cg%3A%22com.google.gwt%22 )
- IE 6/7 support disabled because of upgrade. It can be enabled, but it is going to be removed in the next major release
- More changes on GWT changelog

Tested on:
Firefox 26 on Linux (x64). Ran several tests and Superjumper. 
More testing is appreciated as there is much that needs to be covered and the tests only do so much.

data.title: Fixed AndroidSound objects not pausing and resuming
data.body:
Fixes #1263 on Android, not on desktop.  :( (couldn't trace down where it was going wrong)
Behavior is now alike with music on Android
Extremely minor formatting

data.title: Sounds keeps playing when application is in minimized / paused
MeshBuilder.setUVRanger is wrong.
data.body:
I used meshbuilder to create plane on 0.9.9 release and no problem, but in nightly my texture is inverted vertically. would you please correct this.

this is for 0.9.9  == CORRECT ONE
rect(vertTmp1.set(corner00, normal, null, null).setUV(uMin,vMin),
               vertTmp2.set(corner10, normal, null, null).setUV(uMax,vMin),
            vertTmp3.set(corner11, normal, null, null).setUV(uMax,vMax),
            vertTmp4.set(corner01, normal, null, null).setUV(uMin,vMax));

WRONG on Nightly
rect(vertTmp1.set(corner00, normal, null, null).setUV(uMin,vMax),
            vertTmp2.set(corner10, normal, null, null).setUV(uMax,vMax),
            vertTmp3.set(corner11, normal, null, null).setUV(uMax,vMin),
            vertTmp4.set(corner01, normal, null, null).setUV(uMin,vMin));

data.title: Added sum() and sub() methods in Matrix3
data.body: Added sum() and sub() methods in Matrix3

data.title: Gaps between tiles when zooming on a tiled map
data.body:
To see clearly this issue (which is very common when you zoom in/out on a tiled map, whatever its origin, TMX or tIDE), add in TideMapDirectLoaderTest.java:
camera.zoom = 1.9392626f;
On a Nexus 7 2012, you will clearly see a black line through the clouds and a yelllow line across the water. When you implement the Gesture Detector to zoom at will, it's Christmas (these lines appear or disappear depending on the zoom level).
This bug is not noticeable in portrait mode. Only in landscape.
On a Kindle Fire HD, you will see the same problem with camera.zoom = 1.1985223f;
On other devices, it is visible too.

Version used: latest nightly build

data.title: Added restoring of scroll focus in SelectBox
data.body:
Scroll focus is not restoring after SelectBox has been shown.
I have added restoring in similar way as it was done in Dialog class.

data.title: How to pick touched object from an array of ModelInstances using intersectRayTriangles
Added getScale() and getTranslation() methods
data.body: Closes #1253

data.title: GWT backend bugs on Firefox (glClear seems to fail)
Missing Matrix3 useful methods...
data.body: Matrix3 methods getScale(), getRotation(), getTranslation() are missing.

data.title: BufferUtils: add additional method signatures
data.body: Closes #1251

data.title: Requesting convinience Matrix3 methods
data.body:
I noticed today the very handy Matrix4.mulVec() method. It would be very cool to have something like that for Matrix3 as well.

It also would be nice if there were methods in Matrix3 to interface with Vector3 objects as well, as Matrix3 has atm just method to work with Vector2 objects.

data.title: Broken viewport check in Stage.touchDown() & Stage.mouseMoved()
Make VertexAttributes implement Iterable
data.body:
Closes #1228
Basically includes a copy of Array.ArrayIterable (ReadonlyIterable) and Array.ArrayIterator (ReadonlyIterator), but with a backing fixed array T[] instead of an Array<T> instance. Currently I made them subclasses of the VertexAttributes class, but it's probably better to rename and move them. If you agree, let me know (including a better name) and I will change it accordingly.

Also a minor change: the checkValidity() method is only needed for GLES1.x, so changed the name and only call it when isGL20Available() returns false.

data.title: AmbientCubeMap breaks on transformed Meshes
data.body:
AmbientCubeMap (which is default created in DefaultShader, which is unnessecary in my opinion) does break with world transformed Meshes, and PointLights in the provided Environment.

The precise reason (or a proper fix, if this is not) as to why I cannot give. But the error resides in the **DefaultShader.ACubemap.set()** method:

**renderable.worldTransform.getTranslation(tmpV1);**

If this is commented out, the lighting is restored to normal. Normal in this case means behavior close to ambientCubeMap beeing deactivated, or the GL ES 1.x pipeline.

Broken lighting
![ambientbroken](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1338408/2004113/4d923df6-8699-11e3-8790-6da3f05e98a6.png)

With fix
![ambientfixed](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1338408/2004112/4d907804-8699-11e3-8863-ed784876ca24.png)

AmbientCubeMap off
![ambient_off](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1338408/2004140/e0ebf3fc-869a-11e3-9c36-8f4786b0c28f.png)

GL ES 1.x pipeline
![ambient_gles10](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1338408/2004139/e0e90bf6-869a-11e3-9399-55d615e5718d.png)
